Moreover, we will also see some of the good design practices we should follow in Angular.

title: Implementing a Loading Skeleton in Angular
desc: Skeletons are placeholder elements that are displayed before the actual content is loaded on a webpage. A skeleton is usually a light gray box or circle that you see on websites like Medium, YouTube, etc. Skeletons convey a visual impression of the feature, which gives them an advantage over spinners.

title: Why You Should Not Put Any Logic in the RxJS Subscribe Callback in Angular
desc: Quite frequently, I encounter a big block of imperative code inside a subscribe callback. I have always considered this to be a bad practice. Angular embraces RxJS and the reactive programming paradigm. As Angular developers, we really should be doing the same. This article will be very opinionated, so comments or questions are more than welcome.

title: Overview : Angular — Unit Testing & Code Coverage

title: RxJS based state management in Angular - Part IV
desc:
Challenge: local state
Small and medium scale apps, usually display the list of data once in an app, and in almost the same shape, but the case of the params is different. If you update the param state with a new page of the employees list, you do not expect it to update for companies list as well. So the Param State is actually always local, and should not be provided in root. This is to prevent developers from overlapping params. It should be provided locally, and here is how.

title: The cleanest way to write observable chains
desc:
I am often faced with the case where I need to persist the output of one observable but also use it as the input for other observables. I run into the challenge on how to organize the information cleanly. I am often faced with the following scenario:
I have one observable that emits a value that I need to save and show on the UI
A second observable that needs the value of the first to perform its function.

title: [Angular] Pipes in depth - Pure or Impure?
desc: Probably every Angular developer has already met with the definition of Pipes. Pipes are special classes that have the @Pipe decorator declared above them. In short, Pipes are useful for transforming data. For example, when we have an object property that is originally a date, but we want to make it appear in a prettier form, we should pass that Date object to a date pipe and that way we could modify the appearance of it.

title: Understanding Routing in Angular | Routing | Angular 12+

title: Angular Security Guide

Is your web application secured?' Your web application is the face of your business. There are number of ways by which your web application could be compromised.
- Cross site scripting attacks (XSS)
- SQL Injection
- Client side data storage

title: RxJS switchMap Operator

title: Add maps to your Angular 13 project - get started on Google GeoChart
desc: Use Google Charts to create an aesthetic map to showcase data and attract attention of your customers. In this guide we will go step by step by the process of adding GeoChart to an existing Angular project. With GeoChart you can display the map of entire word, specific country or a region.

title: Add and customize map controls with Angular 13 and OpenLayers
desc: OpenLayers is an open source JavaScript library that is used to add maps to websites. In this guide you will learn to change style of existing map controls, create new custom controls and remove default controls

title: Spring Boot And Angular Full Stack Development | Reddit Clone

We will be using Java 8, Spring Boot, Spring Security, Spring Data JPA, MySQL on the back-end side, and on the front end we will be using Angular 9 and Bootstrap 4. Also, we will be using Token Based Authentication in the form of JSON Web Tokens (JWT).

title: The mysterious three tokens of Angular: APP_BOOTSTRAP_LISTENER, APP_INITIALIZER, PLATFORM_INITIALIZER

In this topic also cover how to create directive and use of @HostListener.

title: Three easy ways to add file upload functionality in Angular project

It includes .jpeg,.jpg,.png, .txt extensions etc. It is a very basic functionality that is available in all types of applications generally.

title: Dynamically load components in Angular 13
desc: Dynamically load components has simplified in Angular 13. Angular team deprecated ViewContainerRef in Angular 13 and we can load components to attached view container without it now.
